abstracts.cdata!:
The Punjab Livestock Project in Pakistan
            was implemented. The project has not achieved its original
            objectives of improving livestock production, and the
            incomes of a large number of farm families in the district
            of Sheikhupura. The project has also strengthened the
            Artificial Insemination (AI) service in Punjab through the
            provision of buildings and equipment which will be useful in
            the future. Likewise, it has provided improved facilities
            and laboratory equipment to the College of Veterinary
            Sciences which can increase the training standard of stock
            assistants in the province and assist provision of extension
            advice to Village Livestock Association (VLA). Particular
            attention should be paid during project formulation to
            limiting the number of components to those strictly
            necessary for attaining the project's main objectives,
            and temptations to address all problems simultaneously.
            Critical examination is recommended at appraisal of the
            designated executing agencies existing and planned
            commitments, organizational structure, modus operandi and
            staff capabilities in order to assess their implementation capacity.
